Art. 4.74. 
Exceptions to the principle of partition in kind 
The rule of partition in kind is derogated from if one of the co-heirs invokes a legal, testamentary or contractual provision which grants him the right to have certain assets of the estate attributed to him or taken over by preference, or to levy them.
If a co-heir who cannot invoke a legal, testamentary or contractual provision to this effect requests the allocation of an undivided asset and the other co-heirs consent, all the heirs may agree that the transferee may not voluntarily dispose of the allocated asset for valuable consideration for a period to be determined, unless all the co-heirs agree. They may also agree that a fixed indemnity will be payable if this prohibition is not complied with.
